data.title: Charlie Stross Book Recommendations & Book Mentions
data.meta_description: Find your next great read among the rants and raves of authors, critics, friends, strangers and culture-makers alike.
data.text:
Strike: Liniertes A5 Notizbuch oder Heft für Schüler, Studenten und Erwachsene

Pm BooksCharlie Stross

You can't go down in the history books as the strike-breaking PM who ordered the army to open fire on the starving nurses if you don't starve them into striking first. https://t.co/ORuMUyUVRF

Out of stock

The Viscount Who Loved Me [Tv Tie-In]: Bridgerton

Julia QuinnCharlie Stross

@quicunquevult "There are eight Bridgerton novels. There are probably going to be eight series of Bridgerton." Yeah but this is TV: if the format is successful they'll make AT LEAST ten seasons before they implode in a fiery crash/dalek invasion (because Julia Quinn isn't in the writers room).

Paperback , 2022

$ 18.99$ 9.49 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

Oath of Fealty

Larry NivenCharlie Stross

One of these days, if I can muster the energy, I really ought to write a novel about a climate change era arcology—run as a commune and besieged by crooked right-wing plutocrats. A direct rebuttal to Niven & Pournelle’s “Oath of Fealty”. Science fiction needs it. https://t.co/JofFagmt7M

Paperback , 2022

$ 17.99$ 8.99 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

Hellstrom's Hive

Frank HerbertCharlie Stross

@thebrainofchris @amendlocke @Annaleen The degenerate outcome of Technocracy is "Hellstrom's Hive" by Frank Herbert: https://t.co/JmtBc3gMBK (Someone should make a movie of that book. Preferably someone with a horror/spy thriller track record.)

Paperback , 2007

$ 18.99$ 9.49 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

Gideon the Ninth

Tamsyn MuirCharlie Stross

@skaffman @hardycoding @Harkaway @scalzi @marthawells1 Strong rec here for "Gideon the Ninth" by Tamsyn Muir, which is totally bonkers (in a good way): also for "The Quantum Thief" by Hannu Rajaniemi (which got unfairly overlooked in favour of The Expanse at the Hugos a few years back—it's absolutely amazing).

Paperback , 2020

$ 18.99$ 9.49 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

Singularity Sky

Charles StrossCharlie Stross

Well, yeah? (And after I did all that, "Singularity Sky" ended up on the Hugo shortlist, as did its sequel, "Iron Sunrise". That was in 2001, I've trad-published about more 30 books since then.) @jodyjsperling https://twitter.com/jodyjsperling/status/1541572084454801410

Paperback, Mass Market , 2004

$ 7.99$ 3.99 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

Breaking the Spell: Religion as a Natural Phenomenon

Daniel C. DennettCharlie Stross

@SHOKUNIN_STUDIO One word answer: Religion. (Daniel Dennett had a to-me convincing explanation in "Breaking the Spell": religion is an emergent side-effect of theory of mind and the intentional stance in consciousness, and fear of death drives people to theorize ways out of the existential trap.)

Paperback , 2007

$ 20.00$ 10.00 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

The Stars My Destination

Alfred BesterCharlie Stross

@TheAuthorGuy Doctor Adder by K. W. Jeter (predated Neuromancer, was circulating for 7 years before cyberpunk came into fashion and it finally sold). "Hardwired" by Walter Jon Williams (similar time-to-market issue). "Schismatrix" by @bruces. "The Stars my Destination", Alfred Bester. …

Paperback , 2011

$ 17.95$ 8.98 + Free shipping50 % off your first book

The Quantum Thief

Hannu RajaniemiCharlie Stross

@skaffman @hardycoding @Harkaway @scalzi @marthawells1 Strong rec here for "Gideon the Ninth" by Tamsyn Muir, which is totally bonkers (in a good way): also for "The Quantum Thief" by Hannu Rajaniemi (which got unfairly overlooked in favour of The Expanse at the Hugos a few years back—it's absolutely amazing).

Paperback , 2014

$ 18.99$ 9.49 + Free shipping50 % off your first book
